testcase

I can reproduce this on FF4 and Trunk. I'm running OSX 10.6.7 on a first-generation unibody macbook pro 15 inch. I have the "2 video card" model, and can reproduce it when either the high-end or the low-end GPU is enabled. dholbert can't reproduce it on a linux nightly.

I was playing around with the Raphael svg library, and I started getting rendering artifacts. I reduced it down to a simple SVG testcase (attached). When I scroll the object out of view, and then scroll it back into view, sometimes I get horizontal lines parallel to the scroll line and through the endpoints. Scrolling around some more or alt-tabbing make them go away, which makes me think it's an invalidation bug.

The really weird thing is that this occurs in Webkit (chrome + safari) as well as Firefox, which makes me wonder if there's some common GFX code between the engines on OSX. Whatever the cause, it looks pretty bad.
